com.actinarium.rhythm.layer

Class Keyline

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.actinarium.rhythm.layer.Keyline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RhythmSpecLayer

    public class Keyline
extends java.lang.Object
implements RhythmSpecLayer
    A layer that draws a horizontal or vertical full-bleed keyline at the specified distance from the specified edge of a view. Can be used to draw “thin” keylines, as well as thick highlights (e.g. margins in avatar list view), although it's recommended to use Fill inside an Inset for the latter. The keyline is drawn towards the specified edge by default (i.e. touching aligned child views), but this can be tweaked using setAlignOutside(boolean) method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Keyline

        public Keyline(int edgeAffinity,
               int distance)
        Create a layer that draws a horizontal or vertical keyline at a specified distance from required edge
        Parameters:
        edgeAffinity - Defines the edge of the view this keyline must be anchored to. Values (Gravity.LEFT and Gravity.RIGHT) will result in a vertical keyline, and values (Gravity.TOP and Gravity.BOTTOM) will result in a horizontal keyline.
        distance - Distance of this keyline from the specified edge, in pixels
        See Also:
        setAlignOutside(boolean)

      • Keyline

        protected Keyline()

        Create a layer that draws a horizontal or vertical keyline at a specified distance from required edge.

        This is a minimum constructor for the factory — only paints and reusable objects are initialized. Developers extending this class are responsible for setting all fields to proper argument values.

        public Keyline setEdgeAffinity(int edgeAffinity)
        Set edge affinity of the keyline
        Parameters:
        edgeAffinity - Defines the edge of the view this keyline must be anchored to. Values (Gravity.LEFT and Gravity.RIGHT) will result in a vertical keyline, and values (Gravity.TOP and Gravity.BOTTOM) will result in a horizontal keyline.
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this for chaining

      • setThickness

        public Keyline setThickness(int thickness)
        Set keyline thickness
        Parameters:
        thickness - Keyline thickness, in pixels. For keylines keep thickness around a few pixels, whereas for highlights feel free to use as many dips as required.
        Returns:
        this for chaining
        See Also:
        setAlignOutside(boolean)

      • setAlignOutside

        public Keyline setAlignOutside(boolean alignOutside)
        Set keyline alignment. By default, the keyline is drawn towards the specified edge, i.e. if edge affinity is BOTTOM, distance is 24px and thickness is 6px, the keyline will appear as a horizontal rectangle starting at the 18th and ending at the 23rd pixel row from the bottom. You can use this method to override that behavior and make the keyline face outwards (24th to 29th pixel rows in aforementioned example).
        Parameters:
        alignOutside - either false (ALIGN_INSIDE, default) for the keyline to extend towards the edge defined by edge affinity, or true (ALIGN_OUTSIDE) to extend away from the edge
        Returns:
        this for chaining

      • draw

        public void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                 android.graphics.Rect drawableBounds)
        Description copied from interface: RhythmSpecLayer
        Draw itself to the provided canvas within provided bounds according to internal configuration (if any)
        Specified by:
        draw in interface RhythmSpecLayer
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas for the layer to draw itself to
        drawableBounds - Bounds where this layer should draw itself. Since these are the bounds of a RhythmDrawable connected to the view, they are usually the same as the view’s bounds, so you can use this parameter to get the view’s dimensions should you need them.
